page.title: 15TOURIST SURVEY F. OF DEAN
page.content: 73,000 VISITORS COME TO THIS AREA EACH YEAR. A SURVEY OF VISITORS ONE MORNING IN JULY SHOWED THAT 56% OF THE VISITORS CAME FROM OUTSIDE THE AREA AND THE OTHERS FROM THE FOREST AREA. WHEN ASKED WHAT THEY ENJOYED 96% SAID PEACE AND QUIET 76% SAID WAY MARKED PATHS (WITH LEAFLETS) 70% SAID INDUSTRIAL HISTORY (COAL MINES - TRAMWAYS) 68% SAID PONDS AND FISHING 60% SAID PICNIC & BAR-B-Q SITES (SHOP & TOILETS) 52% SAID CAMPING AND CARAVANNING THE FOLLOWING WERE SUGGESTED AS IMPROVEMENTS MORE SPORTS FACILITIES MORE MAPS,SIGN POSTS & TRAIL WALKS LESS LITTER PREVENT SHEEP COMING INTO PICNIC AREAS MORE PUBS AND DISCOS.
